[img]https://i.imgur.com/NOW7jU1.png[/img] Coal in your mountains! Burn wood into charcoal! Use that coal and charcoal to power new work benches, coal braziers and stoves, and a medieval cooler meant to keep food fresh! And more! Pollute the locals?
Adds coal to your game which spawns above and below ground if you use a ground scanner. Refill vanilla benches, torches, and other buildings with coal and charcoal in addition to wood. Additionally, smelt lots of stone blocks to get a little bit of coal. Turn coal into chemfuel.
[b]Sorry, but I'm no longer maintaining my mods. Maybe in the future[/b] [i]Please note 99% of my mods are MIT licensed, meaning you can do whatever you want with it with the requirement of crediting me.[/i]
[b]DO NOT[/b] add this mod mid save: you will get no coal. [b]DO NOT[/b] remove this mod from a save: It will explode.
[h1]Features[/h1] [list] [*]New resources: coal and charcoal. Used as fuel [*]Two research projects: [i]Coal Production[/i] & [i]Coal Generator[/i] [*]Adds new work benches which only use coal (or charcoal): crematorium, smelter, and a grill [*]Coal-fired generator will produce electrical power from coal and charcoal [*]Adds a coal brazier, producing light and a small amount of heat (works with Royalty) [*]The active cooler lowers the temperature in order keep items fresh (35f / 1c) [*]A stove which heats as well as a heater and only requires fuel -- great for tribals [*]Torches, campfires, and the fueled benches now accept coal and charcoal as fuel sources, and in-fact prefer it over wood [/list] [img]https://i.imgur.com/7bPiS9H.png[/img]
[h1]Compatibility[/h1] [list] [*][b]Medieval Times[/b]: most buildings can be refueled with coal/charcoal [*][b]Vanilla Furniture Expanded[/b]: Stone campfire can also make charcoal [*][b]Dub's Bad Hygiene[/b]: Log Boilers may now be fueled with coal and charcoal [*][b]Tribal Signal Fire[/b]: Signal fire can use coal and charcoal [*][b]Gloomy Furniture[/b]: Most furniture can take coal/charcoal [*][b]LOTR: Third Age[/b]: Smithy table supported [*][b]Vanilla Furniture Expanded - Production[/b]: Support for the fueled smelter [*][b]Call of Cthulhu - Cults[/b]: Alcove torch supported [*][b][sd] medicaddons[/b]: Medieval lamp [*][b]Royalty[/b]: Brazier prefer coal and charcoal over wood [*][b]Smoked Meat[/b]: coal for smokehouse and smokepit [*][b]Rim of Madness - Bones[/b]: use the coal smelter for bone recipes [/list]
